All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
Arc
The Arc class models an arc in a Petri net, connecting a Place and a Transition with a specific weight.
ArcDrain
ArcDrain is a specialized ArcPT that removes all tokens from the connected Place when the transition fires.
ArcPT
ArcPT models an arc that goes from a Place to a Transition (Arc Place to Transition).
ArcTP
ArcTP models an arc that goes from a Transition to a Place (Arc Transition to Place).
ArcZero
rcZero is a specialized ArcPT that fires only when the connected Place has zero tokens.
DuplicateArcException
DuplicateArcException is a custom exception class used to indicate that an attempt was made to add an arc that already exists between a given Place and Transition.
IPetriNet
IPetriNet defines the interface for a Petri net, outlining methods for adding,removing, and retrieving places, transitions, and arcs within the net.
MissingArcException
MissingArcException is a custom exception class used to indicate that an expected arc is missing from the Petri net, usually during remove or access operations.
MissingPlaceException
MissingPlaceException is a custom exception class used to indicate that an expected Place is missing from the Petri net, usually during removal or access operations.
MissingTransitionException
MissingTransitionException is a custom exception class used to indicate that an expected Transition is missing from the Petri net, usually during removal or access operations.
NegativeException
NegativeException is a custom exception class used to indicate that a negative value has been provided where it is not permitted, such as for token counts or arc weights.
PetriNet
PetriNet implements the IPetriNet interface, providing methods to manage places, transitions, and various arcs in a Petri net, including adding, removing, and retrieving components.
Place
Place models a location in the Petri net where tokens are held.
Transition
Transition models a transition in the Petri net.
